page.title: 10Walsingham Foundry
page.content: The foundry,then called the{North {Norfolk Ironworks}was founded in{1809 by the{Cornish}family.They made all forms of iron castings for the farming industry and under royal patronage made wagons,tumbrils etc.War casualities ended the male line and so in{1918}it was sold to the{Wright family.The foundry continued to trade until{1932}when depression caused its closure.It was purchased by the {Barnhams}the present owners in{1938 and renamed the{Walsingham Foundry {Co.}Items made include agricultural implements,floor tiles for the brewing industry,a range of pumps,castings for canneries,firebars and backplates, stokers for self_feed coal_fired boilers,grates and ornamental fire baskets.15 are employed,8 on the casting floor.A cast is made every 7 working days.
